meanings.sent1: In the office, our cohort worked together on the project.
meanings.sent2: The cohort of friends went on a camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The cohort of ducks waddled in a line behind their leader.
meanings.sent4: The cohort of stars shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The cohort of students cheered as they won the competition.

meanings.sent1: My cohort and I always have lunch together.
meanings.sent2: She considered her dog to be her loyal cohort.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat and dog made quite the cohort in causing trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite book characters became her cohort in adventures.
meanings.sent5: The cohort of siblings played games together every evening.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals having a statistical factor in common
meanings.sent1: The health study followed a cohort of patients over ten years.
meanings.sent2: The cohort of babies born in 2020 had similar birth weights.
meanings.sent3: The cohort of marathon runners all trained in the same park.
meanings.sent4: The cohort of employees hired in January shared a strong work ethic.
meanings.sent5: The cohort of travelers all visited the same exotic destination.
